sen.j: 勾玉（まがたま、曲玉とも表記）は、古代の日本における装身具の一つである。
sen.e: Magatama (also written with the characters for "curved jewels") have been used for personal adornment in Japan since ancient times.
Magatama (also written with the characters for "curved jewels") have been used for personal adornment in Japan since ancient times.
Magatama (also written with the characters for "curved jewels") have been used for personal adornment in Japan since ancient times.

sen.j: 曲玉とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: Magatama are also called curved jewels.
Magatama are also called curved jewels.
Magatama are also called "曲玉 (magatama)", curved jewels.

sen.j: Cの字形またはコの字形に湾曲し、玉から尾が出たような形をしている。
sen.e: A magatama is formed in the shape of the letter "C", and is curved, appearing as if it is a jewel that has a tail.
A magatama is formed in the shape of the letter "C", and is curved, appearing as if it is a jewel that has a tail.
A magatama is formed in the shape of the letter "C", and is curved, appearing as if it is a jewel that has a tail.

sen.j: 丸く膨らんだ一端に穴をあけて紐を通し、首飾りとした。
sen.e: A hole is opened on the rounder end, and a string is passed through the jewel, which is then worn as a necklace.
A hole is opened on the rounder end, and a string is passed through the jewel, which is then worn as a necklace.
A hole is opened on the rounder end, and a string is passed through the jewel, which is then worn as a necklace.

sen.j: 孔のある一端を頭、湾曲部の内側を腹、外側を背と呼ぶ。
sen.e: The end at which the hole has been provided is called the head, the inner curve portion of the jewel the belly, and the outer curve the back.
The end at which the hole has been provided is called the head, the inner curve portion of the jewel the belly, and the outer curve the back.
The end at which the hole has been provided is called the head, the inner curve portion of the jewel the belly, and the outer curve the back.

sen.j: 多くはヒスイ、メノウ、石英、滑石で作られ、土器製のものもある。
sen.e: Many magatama are fashioned from jade, agate, quartz and talc, and there are also magatama fashioned fashioned from clay and fired in a kiln.
Many magatama are fashioned from jade, agate, quartz and talc, and there are also magatama fashioned fashioned from clay and fired in a kiln.
Many magatama are fashioned from jade, agate, quartz and talc, and there are also magatama fashioned from clay and fired in a kiln.
sen.cmt: and の前のスペース短縮fashioned 一つ削除

sen.j: その形状は、元が動物の牙であったとする説や、太極図を表すとする説、母親の胎内にいる初期の胎児の形を表すとする説などがある。
sen.e: Regarding the shape of the magatama, there is a theory that the magatam was originally made in the form of an animals tusk, a theory that maintains it represents a yin-yang diagram (a figure of Taiji), and a theory that it represents the fetus at an early stage of development in the mothers womb.

Regarding the shape of the magatama, there is a theory that the magatam was originally made in the form of an animals tusk, a theory that maintains it represents a yin-yang diagram (a figure of Taiji), and a theory that it represents the fetus at an early stage of development in the mothers womb.

Regarding the shape of the magatama, there is a theory that the magatam was originally made in the form of an animals tusk, a theory that maintains it represents a yin-yang diagram (a figure of Taiji), and a theory that it represents the fetus at an early stage of development in the mothers womb.
sen.cmt: and の前のスペース短縮

sen.j: 古代から、「魔を避け、幸運を授かる物」とされていた。
sen.e: From ancient times, it has been regarded as an object for "warding off evil and bringing good fortune".
From ancient times, it has been regarded as an object for "warding off evil and bringing good fortune".
From ancient times, it has been regarded as an object for 'warding off evil and bringing good fortune'.

sen.j: 現在では縄文時代極初期の玦状耳飾りが原型であると考えられており、日本の縄文時代の遺跡から発見されるものが最も古い。
sen.e: At present, it is thought that an example of a "Jue"shaped earing from theincipient stage of the Jomon Period represents the original form, and that the magatama discovered at Jomon Period remains are the oldest,

At present, it is thought that an example of a "Jue"shaped earing from theincipient stage of the Jomon Period represents the original form, and that the magatama discovered at Jomon Period remains are the oldest,

At present, it is thought that ketsujo mimikazari (an earing resembling Chinese glassware called 'ketsu') from the incipient stage of the Jomon Period represents the original form, and that the magatama discovered at Jomon Period remains are the oldest,
sen.cmt: 玦状耳飾の訳、訂正theincipient→the incipientan example of 削除

sen.j: 朝鮮半島へも伝播し、B.C.6世紀から3世紀初頭の無文土器時代に微斜長石天河石製の勾玉が見られる。
sen.e: The magatama was also transmitted to the Korean peninsula, and examples of magatama made from microline during the Mumun pottery period from the 6th century B.C. to the 3rd Century B.C. are known.
The magatama was also transmitted to the Korean peninsula, and examples of magatama made from microline during the Mumun pottery period from the 6th century B.C. to the 3rd Century B.C. are known.
The magatama was also transmitted to the Korean peninsula, and examples of magatama made from amazonite during the Mumon pottery period from the 6th century B.C. to the 3rd Century are known.
sen.cmt: Mumun→Mumon微斜長石天河石は緑青色の微斜長石を天河石(amazonite)というそうですので、変更しました。３世紀はＢＣではないと思います。ＢＣ削除しました。

sen.j: 縄文時代早期末から前期初頭に滑石や蝋石のものが出現し、縄文中期にはC字形の勾玉が見られ、後期から晩期には複雑化し、材質も多様化する。
sen.e: Examples of magatama fashioned from talc or pyrophyllite from the end of the incipient stage to the beginning of the early stage of the Jomon Period have been discovered, and magatama in the shape of the letter C are known from the middle of the Jomon Period; from the later part through to the end of the Jomon Period, magatama become more complex, and the types of materials from which they were fashioned also became diversified.

Examples of magatama fashioned from talc or pyrophyllite from the end of the incipient stage to the beginning of the early stage of the Jomon Period have been discovered, and magatama in the shape of the letter C are known from the middle of the Jomon Period; from the later part through to the end of the Jomon Period, magatama become more complex, and the types of materials from which they were fashioned also became diversified.

Examples of magatama fashioned from talc or pyrophyllite from the end of the incipient stage to the beginning of the early stage of the Jomon Period have been discovered, and magatama in the shape of the letter C are known from the middle of the Jomon Period; from the later part through to the end of the Jomon Period, magatama become more complex, and the types of materials from which they were fashioned also became diversified.

sen.j: 縄文時代を通じて勾玉の大きさは、比較的小さかった。
sen.e: Throughout the Jomon Period, the size of the magatama was comparatively small.
Throughout the Jomon Period, the size of the magatama was comparatively small.
Throughout the Jomon Period, the size of the magatama was comparatively small.

sen.j: 弥生時代中期に入ると、前期までの獣形勾玉、緒締形勾玉から洗練された定形勾玉と呼ばれる勾玉が作られ始め、古墳時代ごろから威信財とされるようになった。
sen.e: With entry into the middle part of the Yayoi Period, a more evolved from of the magatama is first made, the so-called "classical magatama", which was a more refined form than the crude forms of early magatama that had been made through the early part of the Yayoi Period, and from around the Kofun Period, possession of a magatama was considered to be a mark of prestige.
sen.cmt: 獣形勾玉, 緒締形勾玉???
sen.e: With entry into the middle part of the Yayoi Period, a more evolved from of the magatama is first made, the so-called "classical magatama", which was a more refined form than the crude forms of early magatama that had been made through the early part of the Yayoi Period, and from around the Kofun Period, possession of a magatama was considered to be a mark of prestige.

With entry into the middle part of the Yayoi Period, a more evolved from of the magatama is first made, the so-called "classical magatama", which was a more refined form than the crude forms of early magatama including zoomorphic magatama and ojimegata (a kind of fastener shape) magatama that had been made through the early part of the Yayoi Period, and from around the Kofun Period, possession of a magatama was considered to be a mark of prestige.
sen.cmt: 獣形勾玉, 緒締形勾玉追記

sen.j: 1993年に東京都板橋区四葉遺跡の弥生末期の方形周濠墓から長さ7.4センチメートルのヒスイの勾玉が出土している。
sen.e: In 1993, a 7.4 cm jade magatama was excavated from the later Yayoi Period remains at the Yotsuba Ruins, in Itabashi Ward, Tokyo.
In 1993, a 7.4 cm jade magatama was excavated from the later Yayoi Period remains at the Yotsuba Ruins, in Itabashi Ward, Tokyo.
In 1993, a 7.4 cm jade magatama was excavated from the later Yayoi Period remains at the Yotsuba Ruins, in Itabashi Ward, Tokyo.

sen.j: 古墳時代前期の古墳から硬玉ヒスイの勾玉が出土することが多い。
sen.e: Magatama are often found during the excavation of tombs from the early part of the Kofun Period.
Magatama are often found during the excavation of tombs from the early part of the Kofun Period.
Magatama of jadeite are often found during the excavation of tombs from the early part of the Kofun Period.

sen.j: 大阪府和泉市黄金塚古墳では、大小の勾玉が34個も見つかっている。
sen.e: Thirty-four large and small sized magatama have been discovered at the imperial mausolea and tombs of Koganeduka in Izumi City, Osaka Prefecture.
Thirty-four large and small sized magatama have been discovered at the imperial mausolea and tombs of Koganeduka in Izumi City, Osaka Prefecture.
Thirty-four large and small sized magatama have been discovered at the imperial mausolea and tombs of Koganezuka in Izumi City, Osaka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Thirty-four→文頭のためアラビア数字に直しません。Koganeduka→Koganezuka

sen.j: この内にはヒスイの勾玉が26個が含まれている。
sen.e: Twenty-six jade magatama are included among these thirty-four magatama.
Twenty-six jade magatama are included among these thirty-four magatama.
Twenty-six jade magatama are included among these 34 magatama.

sen.j: 古墳出土の勾玉の大きなもので3～4センチメートルであるが、1912年発掘の大阪府堺市の塚周り古墳（大山古墳の陪墳か）出土の大勾玉は、長さ約6センチメートルである。
sen.e: Although the larger of the magatama excavated from tombs are in the 3-4 cm range, a magatama of 6 cm in length was excavated from the imperial mausolea and tombs of Tsukamawari (a Befun (sub-section) of imperial mausolea and tombs of Oyama) in Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture in 1912.

Although the larger of the magatama excavated from tombs are in the 3-4 cm range, a magatama of 6 cm in length was excavated from the imperial mausolea and tombs of Tsukamawari (a Befun (sub-section) of imperial mausolea and tombs of Oyama) in Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture in 1912.

Although the larger of the magatama excavated from tombs are in the 3-4 cm range, a magatama of 6 cm in length was excavated from the imperial mausolea and tombs of Tsukamawari (which might be a Baifun (tombs of the vassals and their famlies) of imperial mausolea and tombs of Oyama) in Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture in 1912.

sen.j: 古墳時代前期の博労町遺跡から、全国初の2個が背中合わせになったX字形の勾玉が発掘された。
sen.e: The first two magatama that form an X shape when put together back-to-back discovered in the country were found in remains at Bakuro-machi, from the early part of the Kofun Period.
The first two magatama that form an X shape when put together back-to-back discovered in the country were found in remains at Bakuro-machi, from the early part of the Kofun Period.
The first two magatama that form an X shape when put together back-to-back discovered in the country were found in remains at Bakuro-machi, from the early part of the Kofun Period.

sen.j: 鳥取県米子市の博労町遺跡から発掘。
sen.e: They were excavated from the ruins in the disctrict of Yoneko City, Tottori Prefecture.
They were excavated from the ruins in the disctrict of Yoneko City, Tottori Prefecture.
They were excavated from the ruins at Bakuro-machi in Yonago City, Tottori Prefecture.

sen.j: 産経新聞2008年4月4日付より。
sen.e: From an article reported in the Sankei News, April 4, 2008.
From an article reported in the Sankei News, April 4, 2008.
From an article reported in the Sankei News, April 4, 2008.

sen.j: 天皇家に伝わる三種の神器の一つに、八尺瓊勾玉という勾玉が数えられる。
sen.e: The Yasakani no magatama is included as one of the three Sacred Treasures (Imperial Regalia) passed along within the Imperial family.
The Yasakani no magatama is included as one of the three Sacred Treasures (Imperial Regalia) passed along within the Imperial family.
The Yasakani no magatama is included as one of the three Sacred Treasures (Imperial Regalia) passed along within the Imperial family.

sen.j: また武寧王陵など大韓民国内の王墓からも発掘されており、これらは日本から伝来したものという説が有力である。
sen.e: In addition, magatama have been excavated at royal tombs in Korea, such as those at, and the theory that these originated in Japan is widely accepted.
In addition, magatama have been excavated at royal tombs in Korea, such as those at, and the theory that these originated in Japan is widely accepted.
In addition, magatama have been excavated at royal tombs in Korea, such as those at Tomb of King Muryong, and the theory that these originated in Japan is widely accepted.
